items.title: Titagarh Rail shares in focus as Morgan Stanley reiterates "overweight" stance, reduces target price
items.description: Morgan Stanley highlighted that the inadequate supply of freight wheelsets from Indian Railways is expected to hinder Titagarh's earnings offtake

items.title: Nuvama Wealth Management stock in focus as PAG explores options to divest 54% stake
items.description: Blackstone-backed PAG may divest its majority stake in Nuvama Wealth Management, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Bharti Airtel shares in focus on confirming discussions with Tata Group to merge DTH biz
items.description: Bharti Airtel confirmed its 'bilateral discussions' with the Tata Group to consider merging Tata Play's DTH business with Bharti Telemedia.

items.title: Brokerages weigh in on UltraTech Cement’s C&W entry; Jefferies sees buying opportunity
items.description: UltraTech Cement will set up a Cables & Wires in Gujarat, with a capital expenditure of Rs 1,800 crore over next two years.

items.title: Tata Power shares in focus on MoU with Assam govt to develop 5000 MW energy
items.description: Tata Power Share Price | Tata Power ‘s subsidiary Tata Power Renewable Energy has signed one more MoU with Assam Power Distribution Company Limited (APDCL) to drive renewable energy adoption and enhance energy efficiency across the state.

items.title: Waaree Energies shares in focus on winning order to supply solar modules
items.description: Waaree Energies Share Price | The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 3,740.75 and a 52-week low of Rs 2,030.00 on 06 November, 2024 and 27 January, 2025, respectively.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continued their selling on fifth day in a row, as they sold equities worth Rs 3529 crore on February 25. However, domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 3030 crore, on the same day.

items.description: Let's catch up on the latest news from the stock market. From significant investments to major deals, appointments, and acquisitions, here’s a quick look at which stocks will be in focus in today's trade:

items.title: US FDA issues warning letter to Granules India's Gagillapur facility
items.description: Granules India share price: The development may temporarily delay the approval of pending product submissions from the site, but existing manufacturing and distribution operations remain unaffected.

items.title: Sadhna Broadcast case: Sebi bars Ravindra Dahyabhai Patel from dealing in securities for 6 months
items.description: A notice of demand was issued to the Patel on February 6, 2025, for Rs 72.8 lakh as the settlement amount and Rs 1.9 crore as the disgorgement amount. And Patel had remitted the said amounts on February 19.

items.title: Tractor, PV sales to grow in February while 2Ws, CVs may struggle, says Nuvama Institutional Equities
items.description: The PV segment is set to maintain its momentum, growing at around 5 percent YoY, led by strong demand in northern and western India, Nuvama says.

items.title: DroneAcharya Aerial share price recovers 8% from intra-day low on DGCI approval for AgriVeer
items.description: "Equipped with next-generation AI-powered capabilities, the company continues to push the boundaries of technology, delivering state-of-the-art solutions tailored to industry needs," the company said in a regulatory filing on February 27.

items.title: A first in 29 years! Nifty sees fifth straight monthly decline as valuation worries persist
items.description: Small- and mid-cap stocks, typically the hardest hit during market downturns, have taken a severe beating this year, tumbling 14% and 19.2%, respectively.

items.title: Aditya Birla firm Century Enka's shares crash 11% after fire at Gujarat plant disrupts production
items.description: No injuries or casualties were reported in the incident, said the company, adding that the fire was contained at the time of communication to the exchange, but it resulted in a disruption of production.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on February 27
items.description: Indian equity markets opened slightly higher and then moved on to turning flat with Sensex closing at a gain of 0.014% while Nifty lost 0.011%

items.title: Taking Stock: Market ends flat on Feb expiry day; NBFC rallies post RBI circular
items.description: Shriram Finance, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, Sun Pharma, Hindalco Industries were among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers were UltraTech Cement, Trent, Jio Financial, Bajaj Auto and Tata Motors. Except bank and metal, all other sectoral indices ended in the red auto, media, energy, capital goods, realty, power down 1-2 percent.

items.title: Real estate shares extend losses for a fourth session, Prestige Estates top loser after I-T search
items.description: This correction comes amid concerns over investor interest in the sector, given the soaring property prices in major metros.

items.title: Sell Dilip Buildcon; target of Rs 385: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bearish on Dilip Buildcon has recommended sell rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 385 in its research report dated February 27, 2025.

items.title: Accumulate Cyient; target of Rs 1507: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Cyient with a target price of Rs 1507 in its research report dated February 25, 2025.

items.title: BSE Smallcap down for fourth session, poised to end February with a double-digit cut
items.description: The month of February has traditionally been one that has seen underperformance by the smallcap index, with 12 out of last 17 years giving negative returns.

items.title: How SEBI plans to curb manipulation in F&O stocks
items.description: The recent changes by SEBI make operations more expensive for market players. From now on, the computation of the MWPL will only consider the OIs of options closer to the current market price. These options are more expensive than OTM options, complicating pushing a stock onto the ban list

items.title: INOX India shares reverse recent losses to rise 13% after bagging top certification as cryogenic equipment maker
items.description: INOX India becomes India’s first cryogenic equipment manufacturer to receive the IATF 16949 certification after a rigorous audit of its Kalol facility in Gujarat.

items.title: Agri Picks Report February 27, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, The area sown under summer crops in Gujarat as of Monday reached 179,740 hectares, up 0.6% from 178,660 hectares sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Bank Nifty snaps 4-day losing streak as RBI rolls back NBFC loan risk weight hike
items.description: The rally in banking stocks came in after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) reversed its earlier decision to increase the risk weight on bank loans to non-banking financial companies (NBFCs)
